dcterms:description: A large dataset containing 112,120 chest X-ray images collected from 30,805 patients, with disease labels extracted from radiology reports and a total of 984 bounding boxes for 8 types of chest diseases annotated for 880 images.
dcterms:title: NIH Chest X-ray Dataset

dcterms:description: A computational radiomics system used to extract radiomic features from medical images, which are crucial for the analysis of chest X-rays in this study.
dcterms:title: Pyradiomic Tool

dcterms:creator: Pranav Rajpurkar
Jeremy Irvin

dcterms:description: A deep learning model that achieves radiologist-level pneumonia detection on chest X-rays, serving as a baseline for comparison in this study.
dcterms:title: CheXNet

dcterms:creator: Ramprasaath R Selvaraju
Abhishek Das
Ramakrishna Vedantam

dcterms:description: A technique that generates visual explanations for deep learning models, used in this study to highlight crucial regions in chest X-rays.
dcterms:title: Grad-CAM
